complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break down the CSV template file creation task into subtasks covering: 1) Header definition and formatting, 2) Sample data generation with realistic values, and 3) Documentation/comments implementation including format guidance.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: This is a relatively straightforward task with clear requirements. The CSV structure is well-defined with specific headers and formatting needs. The complexity comes from ensuring proper CSV formatting and creating realistic sample data.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break down the CSV file upload component implementation into subtasks covering: 1) Core drag-and-drop functionality, 2) File validation and error handling, 3) Upload progress visualization, and 4) Event emission and integration with parent components.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: This task involves creating a React component with multiple interactive features. While libraries like react-dropzone can help with core functionality, there's still significant work in handling validation, progress indication, and proper event emission. The component needs to handle various states and user interactions.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break down the import UI workflow implementation into subtasks covering each screen in the flow: 1) Start screen with file upload, 2) Validation results screen, 3) Duplicate resolution screen, 4) Confirmation screen, 5) Results screen, and 6) Navigation and state management between screens.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: This is a complex UI task involving multiple screens with different functionality and state management. The workflow needs to maintain state across steps, handle navigation, display different UI based on validation results, and integrate with multiple services. Responsive design requirements add additional complexity.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break down the implementation of Supabase authentication with email/password into detailed subtasks, including configuration, sign-up flow, sign-in functionality, session management, user profile creation, and error handling.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Authentication is a critical security feature requiring careful implementation across multiple components. The task involves complex state management, security considerations, and integration with external services. The existing 6 subtasks cover the necessary components well.

complexityAnalysis.taskTitle: Feature: Implement Contact Management CRUD Operations
complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break down the implementation of contact management CRUD operations into detailed subtasks, including database schema design, tRPC procedures for each operation type, UI components, profile image handling, and the refactoring of client name fields.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: This task involves full-stack development with database schema design, backend API implementation, and frontend components. It requires handling complex data relationships, file uploads for profile images, and implementing pagination, filtering, and sorting. The existing 8 subtasks provide good coverage.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break down the implementation of contact grouping functionality into detailed subtasks, including database schema design for many-to-many relationships, tRPC procedures for group operations, UI components for group management, and filtering/display of contacts by group.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: This feature requires implementing a many-to-many relationship between contacts and groups, which adds complexity to both the database schema and API design. The UI components need to handle multiple selection, group management, and filtering. The 5 existing subtasks cover the necessary components well.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break down the implementation of AI-powered contact enrichment into detailed subtasks, including OpenRouter integration, prompt design, enrichment service with status tracking, response parsing, tRPC procedures, UI components, and error handling/retry mechanisms.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: This is a complex feature involving AI integration, asynchronous processing, and sophisticated data handling. It requires designing effective prompts, parsing unstructured AI responses, and implementing a robust status tracking system. The 7 existing subtasks provide comprehensive coverage of the necessary components.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break down the implementation of the main dashboard into detailed subtasks, including layout design, recent activity feed, upcoming reminders widget, frequent contacts display, metrics visualization, and quick add functionality.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Creating a dashboard involves multiple data sources, complex UI components, and real-time updates. Each widget requires specific data fetching, processing, and visualization. The 6 existing subtasks effectively cover the main components needed for a comprehensive dashboard.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break down the implementation of the reminder system into detailed subtasks, including database schema design, tRPC procedures for CRUD operations, UI components for reminder form and listing, filtering capabilities, and integration with contact detail views.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: The reminder system requires date/time handling, recurrence patterns, and integration with contacts. It involves both backend database work and frontend components for creating, displaying, and managing reminders. The 5 existing subtasks provide good coverage of the necessary components.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break down the implementation of interaction tracking into detailed subtasks, including database schema design, tRPC procedures for CRUD operations, UI components for recording and displaying interactions, and logic to update the last_contacted_at field on contacts.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: This feature requires tracking various types of interactions with timestamps and summaries, displaying them in different formats (list, timeline), and updating related contact data. The 5 existing subtasks cover the necessary components well.

complexityAnalysis.taskTitle: Feature: Implement User Profile and Settings
complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break down the implementation of user profile and settings management into detailed subtasks, including database schema extensions, tRPC procedures for profile/settings management, UI components for viewing/editing profile information, and UI components for application settings.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: This feature involves user data management and application configuration. While important, it's less complex than some other features as it deals with well-defined user data and settings. The 4 existing subtasks cover the necessary components well.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break down the implementation of global search functionality into detailed subtasks, including database query optimization, tRPC search procedures, search input UI with suggestions, search results display, filtering capabilities, and recent searches functionality.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Global search is complex as it requires efficient querying across multiple entity types, relevance ranking, and a responsive UI. It needs database optimization, backend API development, and sophisticated frontend components. The 6 existing subtasks provide comprehensive coverage.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break down the implementation of responsive design into detailed subtasks, including establishing design principles and breakpoints, implementing responsive layouts, creating mobile-friendly navigation, optimizing forms and controls for touch interfaces, and ensuring proper typography and spacing across device sizes.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Responsive design requires careful planning and implementation across the entire application. It involves creating flexible layouts, touch-friendly controls, and ensuring usability across various device sizes. The 5 existing subtasks cover the key aspects of responsive design.

complexityAnalysis.taskTitle: Feature: Implement Error Handling and Logging System
complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break down the implementation of error handling and logging into detailed subtasks, including designing the error handling architecture, implementing React error boundaries, creating structured tRPC error handling, building a toast notification system, setting up a logging service, and developing fallback UIs and retry mechanisms.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: A comprehensive error handling system requires work at multiple levels of the application stack. It involves client-side error boundaries, API error formatting, user notifications, server logging, and recovery mechanisms. The 6 existing subtasks provide good coverage of these components.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break down the implementation of manual data import/export functionality into detailed subtasks, including file upload and parsing, data mapping and validation, duplicate detection and handling, progress indicators for batch operations, error handling for malformed files, and export functionality with format selection.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Data import/export involves complex file parsing, validation, error handling, and database operations. It requires handling large datasets, detecting duplicates, and providing user feedback. The 6 existing subtasks cover the necessary components well.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break down the implementation of accessibility features into detailed subtasks, including conducting an accessibility audit, implementing ARIA attributes and roles, enhancing keyboard navigation, optimizing visual accessibility, implementing screen reader support, and creating accessible forms.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Implementing accessibility to WCAG 2.1 AA standards requires detailed work across the entire application. It involves technical implementation (ARIA, keyboard navigation), visual design (contrast, focus indicators), and testing with assistive technologies. The 6 existing subtasks provide comprehensive coverage.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break down the implementation of performance optimizations into detailed subtasks, including setting up performance measurement, implementing code splitting and React.memo optimizations, optimizing database queries, setting up caching strategies, implementing virtualized lists, optimizing images, and adding prefetching and debouncing techniques.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Performance optimization is highly complex as it spans the entire application stack and requires specialized knowledge in various areas. It involves frontend optimizations, backend efficiency, database tuning, and network optimizations. The 7 existing subtasks provide good coverage of these areas.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break down the implementation of a CI/CD pipeline into detailed subtasks, including setting up GitHub Actions workflows, configuring automated testing, creating build process scripts, setting up Vercel project environments, implementing database migration handling, and creating monitoring and rollback procedures.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Setting up a CI/CD pipeline involves multiple technologies and careful configuration. It requires automated testing, build processes, deployment strategies, database migrations, and monitoring. The 6 existing subtasks cover the necessary components well.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break down the implementation of security measures into detailed subtasks, including setting up Content Security Policy, implementing XSS and CSRF protection, configuring secure cookies and session management, adding rate limiting, implementing input sanitization, configuring HTTP security headers, and setting up secure API key handling and CORS policies.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Security implementation is highly complex and critical, requiring specialized knowledge across multiple domains. It involves protecting against various attack vectors, securing data in transit and at rest, and implementing proper authentication and authorization. The 7 existing subtasks provide comprehensive coverage.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break down the implementation of an automated testing framework into detailed subtasks, including setting up Vitest for unit testing, configuring React Testing Library, implementing Mock Service Worker for API mocking, setting up a test database environment, configuring Playwright or Cypress for E2E testing, and implementing test coverage reporting and CI integration.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Setting up a comprehensive testing framework involves multiple testing types and tools. It requires unit, integration, and E2E testing setup, mock implementations, test database configuration, and CI integration. The 6 existing subtasks cover these components well.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break down the implementation of a documentation system into detailed subtasks, including setting up API documentation for tRPC procedures, implementing JSDoc for code documentation, creating user guides and FAQs, developing developer documentation with architecture diagrams, and setting up a documentation website or wiki.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Creating a comprehensive documentation system requires work across different documentation types (API, code, user, developer). While important, it's less technically complex than some other features. The 5 existing subtasks provide good coverage of the necessary components.
